news.title: 2017 Fundraiser
news.body:
Our goal is to raise $45,000 this year to continue our award-winning programs in NC, SC, NY and IN; to offer free writing classes to young people in Western North Carolina at area libraries; and to give workshop scholarships to low-income writers.

Only your tax-deductible donation will make these worthy goals possible! A $50 donation will establish you as a Friend of the Arts, and help us towards our fundraising goal. A donation of $75 or more includes a year's membership, which entitles you to discounts on all workshops and contests.

Click here to donate or to join The Writers' Workshop. As always, any amount would be greatly appreciated!

news.title: May 18-21, 2017:  Folly Beach Writers' Retreat
news.body:
Join us for our bi-annual Writers’ Retreat at Folly Beach, near Charleston, SC - an ideal place to relax, write and review each other’s work. Participants will engage in a total of 6 sessions, led by Workshop instructors. Carpooling from Asheville is available. The all-inclusive rate (except for meals) is $495 for a private room, or $450 shared. The commuter rate is $55 per day.

To register, please contact writersw@gmail.com, or call 828-254-8111.

workshops.title: Writing the Novel
workshops.description: The class will learn the key aspects to any good novel – creating unforgettable characters, developing conflict, tension and honest dialogue, and describing a sense of place. Readings of award-winning literary novelists will serve as examples of fine writing. Editing techniques will also be taught, including eliminating unnecessary details, building tension, and fine-tuning dialogue and descriptions. Participants may bring a synopsis and five pages (double-spaced) to the class for review.

instructors.name: Karen Ackerson
instructors.description: Ackerson is Senior Editor at the Renbourne Editorial Agency, and has edited hundreds of novels and memoirs. She has taught workshops throughout the Southeast for over 20 years.
